meanings.sent1: The arrogant arrogator believed he was always right.
meanings.sent2: The teacher, an arrogator of knowledge, never admitted when she was wrong.
meanings.sent3: The little boy playfully pretended to be an arrogator of toys, claiming all the toys in the room as his own.
meanings.sent4: The CEO was an arrogator of success, always taking credit for his team's hard work.
meanings.sent5: In the land of make-believe, the wizard was known as the arrogator of spells, casting magic wherever he went.

meanings.definition: To claim or seize without justification
meanings.sent1: She tried to arrogator the last piece of cake, but her brother caught her in the act.
meanings.sent2: The thief arrogated the valuable painting from the museum, thinking he could get away with it.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel arrogated all the nuts from the tree, thinking no one would notice.
meanings.sent4: The dictator arrogated power from the people, ruling with an iron fist.
meanings.sent5: The bully arrogated control of the playground, making all the other kids follow his rules.
